trans-unit.source: Pass a function to when option to retry only when error matches the expected one.

Passing a function will enable you to provide your own chunking algorithm. The first argument passed to you function is an array of all test files, if you enabled grep the test files passed are already filtered to match the grep pattern.
Pauses execution for a number of seconds.

Perform a click on a link or a button, given by a locator. If a fuzzy locator is given, the page will be searched for a button, link, or image matching the locator string. For buttons, the "value" attribute, "name" attribute, and inner text are searched. For links, the link text is searched. For images, the "alt" attribute and inner text of any parent links are searched.
Perform a rotation gesture centered on the specified element.
Perform a shake action on the device.
Perform a swipe down on an element.
Perform a swipe in selected direction on an element to searchable element.
Perform a swipe left on an element.
Perform a swipe on the screen or an element.
Perform a swipe right on an element.
Perform a swipe up on an element.
Performs a click on a link and waits for navigation before moving on.
Performs a double-click on an element matched by link|button|label|CSS or XPath. Context can be specified as second parameter to narrow search.
Performs a specific touch action. The action object need to contain the action name, x/y coordinates
Performs right click on an element matched by CSS or XPath.
Performs right click on an element matched by CSS or XPath. Appium: support, but in apps works as usual click

Please note that some config changes can't be applied on the fly. For instance, if you set restart: false in your config and then changing value browser won't take an effect as browser is already started and won't be closed untill all tests finish.

Please note, you can't run tests by different helpers at once. You can't use some APIs from WebDriverIO and some from Nightmare. You should pick one helper, as it definses how tests are executed. If requirements change it's easy to migrate to another, but don't use few helpers at once. It's just not possible.
Please notice that instead of I you should use this in current context.
Please refer to Selenium - Proxy Object for more information.
Please refer to translated steps inside translation files and send Pull Requests to add missing.
Please use verbose output when reporting issues to GitHub.
Plugin can register event listeners or hook into promise chain with recorder. See API reference.
Plugins allow to use CodeceptJS internal API to extend functionality. Use internal event dispatcher, container, output, promise recorder, to create your own reporters, test listeners, etc.

Presses a key on a focused element. Special keys like 'Enter', 'Control', etc will be replaced with corresponding unicode. If modifier key is used (Control, Command, Alt, Shift) in array, it will be released afterwards.
Prints all available methods of I to console
Produces steps.d.ts file, which referenced in the very beginning of a test file.

Protractor example demonstrates usage of global element and by objects. However browser should be accessed from a helper instance via this.helpers['Protractor']; We also use chai-as-promised library to have nice assertions with promises.
Protractor helper is based on Protractor library and used for testing web applications.
Protractor requires Selenium Server and ChromeDriver/GeckoDriver to be installed. To test non-Angular applications please make sure you have angular: false in configuration file.
Provide a function description as a first parameter, function should return a promise:
Provide an array for the second argument to select multiple options.
Pulls a file from the device.

Puppeteer has a very rich and flexible API. Sure, you can extend your test suites to use the methods listed there. CodeceptJS already prepares some objects for you and you can use them from your you helpers.
Puppeteer starts a browser without showing its window. To see the browser, edit codecept.json config and set show: true for Puppeteer:
Puppeteer uses different strategies to detect if a page is loaded. In configuration use waitForNavigation option for that:
REST API endpoint which allows to perform create / delete requests and
REST helper allows to send additional requests to the REST API during acceptance tests. Unirest library is used to perform requests.
REST helper provides basic methods to send requests to application:
Receive Puppeteer client from a custom helper by accessing browser for the Browser object or page for the current Page object:
Receive a Appium client from a custom helper by accessing browser property:
Receive a WebDriverIO client from a custom helper by accessing browser property:
Remove an app from the device.
Removes mocked Angular module. If modName not specified - clears all mock modules.
Rerun the test to see the browser.
Reset headers for the request to default state
Resize the current window to provided width and height. First parameter can be set to maximize
Result will be located at output/index.html file.
Result will be located at output/result.xml file.
Retries each failed step in a test.
Retrieves a page scroll position and returns it to test. Resumes test execution, so should be used inside an async function with await operator.
Retrieves a page title and returns it to test. Resumes test execution, so should be used inside async with await operator.
Retrieves a text from an element located by CSS or XPath and returns it to test. Resumes test execution, so should be used inside async with await operator.
Retrieves a value from a form element located by CSS or XPath and returns it to test. Resumes test execution, so should be used inside async function with await operator.
Retrieves an attribute from an element located by CSS or XPath and returns it to test. Resumes test execution, so should be used inside async with await operator.
Retrieves page source and returns it to test. Resumes test execution, so should be used inside an async function.
Retrieves the innerHTML from an element located by CSS or XPath and returns it to test. Resumes test execution, so should be used inside an async function with await operator.

Retrieves the innerHTML from an element located by CSS or XPath and returns it to test. Resumes test execution, so should be used inside async function with await operator. Appium: support only web testing
Retry rules are available in array recorder.retries. The last retry rule can be disabled by running recorder.retries.pop();
Run basic suite for chrome and smoke for firefox
Run all suites for all browsers:
Run all tests from current dir
Run all tests without "@IEOnly" word in name
Run basic tests with grep and junit reporter
Run only tests with "signin" word in name
Run regression tests specifying different config path:
Run single test [path to codecept.js] [test filename]
Run single test in debug mode
Run single test with steps printed
Run test with internal logs printed (global promises, and events).
Run tests and produce xunit report:
Run tests with allure plugin enabled:
Same as Before you can use After to run teardown for each scenario.
Same thing happens for form fields: they are searched by field names, labels, and so on.

Saves a screenshot to ouput folder (set in codecept.json). Filename is relative to output folder. Optionally resize the window to the full available page scrollHeight and scrollWidth to capture the entire page by passing true in as the second argument.
Scenarios are live examples of feature usage. Inside a feature file it should be written inside a Feature block. Each scenario should contain its title:
Scenarios are written in step-by-step manner using Given-When-Then approach. At start, scenario should describe its context with Given keyword:

Scenarios can become more descriptive when you represent repeating data as tables. Instead of writing several steps "I have product with :num1 $ price in my cart" we can have one step with multiple values in it.
Scrolls to element matched by locator. Extra shift can be set with offsetX and offsetY options
Scrolls to element matched by locator. Extra shift can be set with offsetX and offsetY options Appium: support only web testing
See the example for Posts factories:
See the example providing a factory for User generation:
Select config file manually (-c or --config option)
Selects a checkbox or radio button. Element is located by label or name or CSS or XPath.
Selects an option in a drop-down select. Field is searched by label | name | CSS | XPath. Option is selected by visible text or by value.

Selenium WebDriver is considered to be standard for end to end testing of web applications. Despite its popularity it have its drawbacks, it requires a real browser and Selenium server to control it. This hardens setting it up testing environment for CI server and slows down test execution.
Send GET request to REST API
Send a key event to the device. List of keys: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/KeyEvent.html
Sends input event on a page. Should be a mouse event like: { type: 'mouseDown', x: args.x, y: args.y, button: "left" }
Sends input event on a page. Can submit special keys like 'Enter', 'Backspace', etc
Set WebDriverIO timeouts in realtime. Appium: support only web testing Timeouts are expected to be passed as object:
Set a device orientation. Will fail, if app will not set orientation
Set headers for all next requests
Set the automatic popup response to Accept. This must be set before a popup is triggered.
Set the automatic popup response to Cancel/Dismiss. This must be set before a popup is triggered.
Several plugins can be enabled as well:
Simulate Touch ID with either valid (match == true) or invalid (match == false) fingerprint.
SmartWait can be enabled by setting wait option in WebDriverIO config. Add "smartWait": 5000 to wait for additional 5s.
SmartWait doesn't check element for visibility, so tests may fail even element is on a page.
SmartWait works with a CSS/XPath locators in click, seeElement and other methods. See where it is enabled and where is not:
So there is no magic in testing of AngularJS application in CodeceptJS. You just execute regular Protractor commands, packed in a simple high-level API.
Sometimes it takes some time for a page to respond to user's actions. Depending on app's perfromance this can be either slow or fast.
Sometimes you need to retrieve a data from a page to use it in next steps of a scenario. Imagine, application generates a password and you want to ensure that user can login using this password.
Start an arbitrary Android activity during a session.
Start with creating an MyPuppeteer helper using generate:helper or gh command:
Step definitions are placed in JavaScript file with Given/When/Then functions that map strings from feature file to functions:
Step events provide step objects with following fields:

StepObjects represent complex actions which involve usage of multiple web pages. For instance, creating users in backend, changing permissions, etc. StepObject can be created similarly to PageObjects or PageFragments:
Steps can be either strings or regular expressions. Parameters from string are passed as function arguments. To define parameters in a string we use Cucumber expressions
Steps in background are defined the same way as in scenarios.
Stopping a server from a previous example can be done in a similar manner. Create a teardown file and add it to codecept.json:
Strict locators allow to specify additional locator types:
Such talks should produce written stories. There should be an actor that doing some things, the feature that should be fulfilled within the story and the result achieved.
Sure, Protractor can be used to test applications built without AngularJS. In this case you need to disable angular synchronization feature in config:
Switch focus to a particular tab by its number. It waits tabs loading and then switch tab
Switch to non-Angular mode, start using WebDriver instead of Protractor in this session
Switches current element to found one. Can accept another locate call or strict locator.
Switches frame or in case of null locator reverts to parent.
Switches frame or in case of null locator reverts to parent. Appium: support only web testing
Switches to native context. By default switches to NATIVE_APP context unless other specified.
Switches to web context. If no context is provided switches to the first detected web context
Tables is a recommended ways to pass arrays into test scenarios. Inside a step definition data is stored in argument passed as DataTable JavaScript object. You can iterate on it like this:
Tag should be placed before Scenario: or before Feature: keyword. In the last case all scenarios of that feature will be added to corresponding group.
Take a look at a sample test:
Technically they are the same as PageObjects. StepObjects can inject PageObjects and use multiple POs to make a complex scenarios:
Test events provide a test object with following fields:
Test execution can be paused in any place of a test with pause() call.

Test output and the way tests are written can be localized. This way scenarios can be written in almost native language using UTF support of JavaScript. If you have non-English team and you work on non-English project consider enabling translation by setting translation to one of available languages.

Test scenario should always use I object to execute commands. This is important as all methods of I are running in global promise chain, this way CodeceptJS makes sure everything is executed in right order. At first a page should be opened to proceed, we use amOnPage command for that. As we already specified full URL to TodoMVC app, we can pass relative path into it instead of absolute url:
Tests are expected to be written in ECMAScript 7.
Tests are written from user's perspective. There is an actor (represented as I) which contains actions taken from helpers. A test is written as a sequence of actions performed y actor:
Tests are written in synchronous way. This improves readability and maintainability of tests. While writing tests you should not think about promises. You should focus on test scenario.
Tests consist with a scenario of user's action taken on a page. The most widely used ones are:
Text values inside a scenarios can be set inside a """ block:

The Touch Action API provides the basis of all gestures that can be automated in Appium. At its core is the ability to chain together ad hoc individual actions, which will then be applied to an element in the application on the device. See complete documentation
The idea of story BDD can be narrowed to:

The most efficient way would be to allow test to control its data, i.e. the 3rd option. However, accessing database directly is not a good idea as database vendor, schema and data are used by application internally and are out of scope of acceptance test.
The most general and common assertion is see:
The output should be similar to this:
The same code can be shared for web applications as well. To execute some code in web browser only, use I.runInWeb:
The same way you can also access browser object to implement more actions or handle events. Learn more about Helpers in the corresponding guide.
The second parameter is a context (CSS or XPath locator) to narrow the search.
The similar test written in native syntax of Protractor (inherited from selenium-webdriver) would look like this:

The ubiquitous language is always referred as common language. That is it's main benefit. It is not a couple of our business specification's words, and not a couple of developer's technical terms. It is a common words and terms that can be understood by people for whom we are building the software and should be understood by developers. Establishing correct communication between this two groups people is vital for building successful project that will fit the domain and fulfill all business needs.
Then configure ApiDataHelper to match factories and REST API:
Then create a module which will export a factory for an entity.
Then inside a Helper you can access Puppeteer helper of CodeceptJS. Let's say you want to create I.renderPageToPdf action. In this case you need to call pdf method of page object
Then tests can be executed using run-multiple command.
Then tests with failure will have screenshots.
Then to execute them use run-multiple command passing configured suite, which is parallel in this example:
Then you need to prepare application for execution. It should be packed into apk (for Android) or .ipa (for iOS) or zip.
Then, calling I.have('user') inside a test will create a new user for you. This is done by sending POST request to /api/users URL. Response is returned and can be used in tests.
There are different ways to define bootstrap and teardown functions:
There is a simple way to add additional comments to your test scenario. Use say command to print information to screen:
This Helper uses REST helper and accepts its configuration in "REST" section. So, in order to set default headers or timeout you should add:
This also enables localized method names for actor object.
This can also be used to emulate Ajax requests:
This can be done inside a helper using the global promise recorder:
This command generates a basic helper and appends it to helpers section of config file:

This concept is extended by ApiDataFactory helper. It builds data according to defined rules and uses API to store them and automatically clean them up after a test, This way setting data for a test is as simple as writing:
This helper should be configured in codecept.json
This helper should be configured in codecept.json or codecept.conf.js
This helper solves this problem. Most of web application have API, and it can be used to create and delete test records. By combining REST API with Factories you can easily create records for tests:
This image comes with the necessary dependencies and packages to execute CodeceptJS tests. Mount in your CodeceptJS config directory into the /tests directory in the docker container.
This is a work in progress but you can control two browsers at a time right out of the box. Individual control is something that is planned for a later version.
This is especially useful while writing a new scratch. After opening a page call pause() to start interacting with a page:
This is how we can check that login form of a simple web application works. At first we opened /login page, then filled forms and in the end we saw the greetings text.
This is how we described the initial conditions. Next, we perform some action. We use When keyword for it:
This is useful if you want to execute same tests but on different browsers and with different configurations or different tests on same browsers in parallel.
This launches interactive console where you can call actions of I object.
This method return promise with array of IDs of found elements. Actual elements can be accessed inside evaluate by using codeceptjs.fetchElement() client-side function:
This plugin allows to slow down tests execution when a test running too fast. It puts a tiny delay for before and after action commands.
This plugin is very basic so it's recommended to improve it to match your custom needs.
This requires ./data.js module and assigns it to Data argument in a test.

This sample assertion used _locate helper method which searched for elements by CSS/XPath or a strict locator. Then browser.evaluate method was called to use locate found elements on a page and return attribute from the first of them.
This scenario will be restarted two times on a failure.
This scenarios are nice as live documentation but they do not test anything yet. What we need next is to define how to run those steps. Steps can be defined by executing gherkin:snippets command:
This string can be accessed inside a content property of a last argument:
This test is easy to read and write. Also it will work both on iOS and Android devices. Doesn't it sound cool?

This text should be rewritten to follow your buisness rules. Don't think about a web interface for a while. Think about how user interacts with your system and what goals they want to achieve. Then write interaction scenarios.
This way tests can be written in Chinese language while it is still JavaScript:
This way tests can be written in native language while it is still JavaScript:
This way we recommend to implement all custom logic using low-level Protractor syntax and using it inside scenario tests. Please see an example of such helper.
This way you can call native Nightmare commands.
This way, if your tests are written with TypeScript, your IDE will be able to leverage features like autocomplete and so on.
This will create a sample template for a page object and include it into codecept.json config.
This will give you cli with steps in console and HTML report in output directory.
This will limit data sets accoring passed function:
This will produce 2 tests with different data sets. Current data set is appended to a test name in output:

This will produce code templates for all undefined steps in all feature files of this suite. It will also place stub definitions into step_definitions/steps.js file. Our next step will be to define those steps and transforming feature-file into a valid test.
To debug test step-by-step type next and press Enter. The next step will be executed and interactive shell will be shown again.
To enable your custom plugin in config add it to plugins section. Specify path to node module using require.
To execute commands in context of a webview use within('webview') function:
To execute tests in Google Chrome browser running Selenium Server with ChromeDriver is required.
To execute them use run-multiple command passing configured suite, which is parallel in this example:
To filter a test by name use --grep parameter. Which will execute all tests with names matching the regex pattern.
To get a list of all contexts use grabAllContexts method:

To get additional information about test execution use --debug option. This will show execution steps as well as notices from test runner. To get even more information with more technical details like error stack traces, and global promises, or events use --verbose mode.
To get autocompletion for localized method names generate definitions by running

To inject asynchronous functions in a test or before/after a test you can subscribe to corresponding event and register a function inside a recorder object. Recorder represents a global promises chain.
To launch tests use run command. To execute tests in multiple browsers or multiple threads use run-multiple.
To learn more about refactoring options in CodeceptJS read PageObjects guide.
To list all available commands for current configuration run codeceptjs list or enable auto-completion by generating TypeScript definitions.
To list all defined steps run gherkin:steps command:
To locate a element inside label with text: 'Hello' use:
To make combinations with modifier and mouse clicks (like Ctrl+Click) press a modifier, click, then release it. Appium: support, but clear field before pressing in apps:
To make this work you need
To narrow down the results you can specify a context in second parameter.
To run all tests with slow word in it

To run mobile test you need either an device emulator (available with Android SDK or iOS), real device connected for mobile testing. Alternatively, you may execute Appium with device emulator inside Docker container.
To run only features use --features option:
To run only tests without features use --tests option:
To run several browsers in one test see multiple session chapter.
To run tests and see step-by step output use --steps optoin:
To see all available commands press TAB two times to see list of all actions included in I.
To see all possible assertions see the helper's reference.
To see how the test was executed, use stepByStepReport Plugin. It saves a screenshot of each passed step and shows them in a nice slideshow.
To see more detailed output add --debug flag:
To see not only business steps but an actual performed steps use --debug flag:
To see step-by-step output of running tests, add --steps flag:
To see very detailed output system use --verbose flag:
To set a specific context use { web: 'webview.context' } instead:
To set this option for all scenarios in a file, add retry to a feature:
To skip the global search pass exact strict locator (or start locator with // or . or #). In this case you are not limited to buttons and links. Any element found by that locator is clicked.
To specify exact locator type use strict locators:
To specify the exact area on a page where actions can be performed you can use within function. Everything executed in its context will be narrowed to context specified by locator:
To start please install allure-commandline package (which requires Java 8)
To start using CodeceptJS you will need to install it via NPM and initialize it in directory with tests.

To start writing a test it is important to understand how to locate elements for native mobile applications. In both Android and iPhone elements are defined in XML format and can be searched by XPath locators.
To start you need CodeceptJS with Puppeteer packages installed
To start you need CodeceptJS with nightmare package installed.
To use SmartWait and wait for element to appear on a page, add true as second arg:
To use a Page Fragment within a Page Object, you need to require it on top of the Page Object file:
To use a Page Fragment within a Test Scenario just inject it into your Scenario:
To use it with Nightmare install nightmare and nightmare-upload packages:
To use it with Protractor install protractor package:
To use it with Puppeteer install puppeteer package:
To use it with WebDriverIO install webdriverio package:
To write your tests in portuguese you can enable the portuguese translation in config file like:

Today all modern web applications have REST API. So it is a good idea to use it to create data for a test and delete it after. API supposed to be a stable interface and it can be used by acceptance tests. CodeceptJS provides 2 helpers for Data Management via REST API.
Try to perform your scenario step by step. Then copy succesful commands and insert them into a test.
Turn off the restart option if you want to run your suite in a single browser instance.
Turn on the show option if you want to follow test progress in a window. This is very useful for debugging.
Turn on the show option if you want to follow test progress in a window. This is very useful for debugging. All other options can be taken from NightmareJS API.
Type in different actions to try them, copy valid successful ones to test, update the test file.
TypeScript Definitions allows IDEs to provide autocompletion when writing tests.
UI of your web application has interaction areas which can be shared across different tests. To avoid code duplication you can put common locators and methods into one place.

Unlike Cucumber, CodeceptJS is not about writing test scenarios above for business rules. To say it again, its goal is to provide standard action steps you can use for testing applications. Surely, it can't cover 100% of cases but it aims for 90%, for others you can write your own steps inside a custom Helper using API of Protractor
Unselects a checkbox or radio button. Element is located by label or name or CSS or XPath.
Update the current setting on the device
Use selenium-standalone from NPM to install and run them:

Use default xunit reporter of Mocha to print xml reports. Provide --reporter xunit to get the report to screen. It is recommended to use more powerful mocha-junit-reporter package to get better support for Jenkins CI.
Use regex for more flexible filtering:

Uses Google Chrome's Puppeteer library to run tests inside headless Chrome. Browser control is executed via DevTools without Selenium. This helper works with a browser out of the box with no additional tools required to install.
Using JavaScript-style config codecept.conf.js, bootstrapAll and teardownAll functions can be placed inside of it:
Using such smart locators makes tests easy to write, however, searching an element by text is slower than using CSS|XPath and much slower than using strict locators.
Using values from process.profile you can change the config dynamically. It provides value of --profile option passed to runner. Use its value to change config value on the fly.
Various strategies are used to locate semantic elements. However, they may run slower than specifying locator by XPath or CSS.
Verifies that the specified checkbox is checked.
Verifies that the specified checkbox is not checked.
Waiting for the part of the URL to match the expected. Useful for SPA to understand that page was changed.
Waits for a function to return true (waits for 1 sec by default). Running in browser context.
Waits for a function to return true (waits for 1sec by default).
Waits for a specified number of elements on the page
Waits for a text to appear (by default waits for 1sec). Element can be located by CSS or XPath. Narrow down search results by providing context.
Waits for an element to be removed or become invisible on a page (by default waits for 1sec). Element can be located by CSS or XPath.
Waits for an element to become not attached to the DOM on a page (by default waits for 1sec). Element can be located by CSS or XPath.
Waits for an element to become visible on a page (by default waits for 1sec). Element can be located by CSS or XPath.
Waits for an element to hide (by default waits for 1sec). Element can be located by CSS or XPath.
Waits for element to be present on page (by default waits for 1sec). Element can be located by CSS or XPath.
Waits for element to become clickable for number of seconds.
Waits for element to become enabled (by default waits for 1sec). Element can be located by CSS or XPath.
Waits for navigation to finish. By default takes configured waitForNavigation option.
Waits for the entire URL to match the expected
Waits for the specified value to be in value attribute
Want to have screenshots for failed tests? Then add Mochawesome helper to your config:
Want to use several reporters in the same time? Try to use mocha-multi reporter
We can try to write such simple story:
We need to fill in all those fields and click "Update" button. CodeceptJS matches form elements by their label, name, or by CSS or XPath locators.
We recommend to install them manually or use NPM packages:
Web view uses [aria-label] attribute as accessibility id

WebDriver based helpers like WebDriverIO, Protractor, Selenium WebDriver will require Selenium Server or PhantomJS installed. They will also require ChromeDriver or GeckoDriver to run corresponding browsers.
WebDriverIO helper which wraps webdriverio library to manipulate browser using Selenium WebDriver or PhantomJS.
WebDriverIO makes it possible to execute tests against services like Sauce LabsBrowserStackTestingBot Check out their documentation on available parameters
WebDriverIO requires Selenium Server and ChromeDriver/GeckoDriver to be installed.

What if CodeceptJS doesn't provide some of Protractor functionality you actually need? Sure its API is to general, and this case is possible. If you don't know how to do something with CodeceptJS - revert back to Protractor syntax!
What makes CodeceptJS better for mobile testing? Take a look. Here is the sample test for a native mobile application written in CodeceptJS:
When a test runs faster than application it is recommended to increase waitForAction config value. It will wait for a small amount of time (100ms) by default after each user action is taken.

When enabled, it collects all test files and executes them in parallel by the specified amount of chunks. Given we have five test scenarios (a_test.js,b_test.js,c_test.js,d_test.js and e_test.js), by setting "chunks": 2 we tell the runner to run two suites in parallel. The first suite will run a_test.js,b_test.js and c_test.js, the second suite will run d_test.js and e_test.js.
When opening a web page you can set headers as well. amOnPage methods can take headers as second parameter:
When running steps inside a within block will be shown with a shift:

When using the Multiple Execution mode , there are two additional hooks available; bootstrapAll and teardownAll. These hooks are only called once each; before all of the test suites are run (bootstrapAll) and after all of the test suites have finished (teardownAll).
When we deal with clicks, CodeceptJS can take a text and search a web page for a valid clickable element with that text. So links and buttons can be searched by their text.
When we switch helper to Nightmare:
When you need to rerun scenarios few times just add retries option added to Scenario declaration.
Whenever you execute tests with --verbose option you will see registered events and promises executed by a recorder.

Whenever you start writing a story you are describing a specific feature of an application, with a set of scenarios and examples describing this feature. Let's open a feature file created by gherkin:init command, which is feature/basic.feature.
With this procedure we also ensure that everyone in a team knows what has been developed, what has not, what has been tested and what has not.
Within can return a value which can be used in a scenario:
Within web page you can locate elements, interact with them, and check that expected elements are present on a page. That is what a test look like. That is what a test look like.
Writing good locators can be tricky. The Mozilla team has written an excellent guide titled Writing reliable locators for Selenium and WebDriver tests.
Yes, also the demo project is available on GitHub
You can also specify the exact locator type with strict locators:
You can also switch to JS configuration format for more dynamic options. Create codecept.conf.js file and make it export config property.
You can auto-retry a failed step by enabling retryFailedStep Plugin.
You can check that specific element exists (or not) on a page, as it was described in Locating Element section.
You can either access core Helpers (and underlying libraries) or create a new from scratch.
You can execute CodeceptJS with Puppeteer or Nightmare locally with no extra configuration.
You can include this pageobject in test by its name (defined in codecept.json). In case you created a loginPage object it should be added to list of test arguments to be included in test:
You can inject objects per test by calling injectDependencies function on Scenario:
You can override config for session by passing second parameter:
You can run a specific feature file by its filename or by grepping by name or tag.
You can use grep and outputName params to filter tests and output directory for suite:

You may run use -v $(pwd)/:tests/ if running this from the root of your CodeceptJS tests directory. Note: The output of your test run will appear in your local directory if your output path is ./output in the CodeceptJS configNote: If running with the Nightmare driver, it is not necessary to run a selenium docker container and link it. So --link selenium-chrome:selenium may be omitted

You need to upload your Android app (.apk) or iOS app (.ipa) to the BrowserStack servers using the REST API before running your tests. The App URL (bs://hashed appid) is returned in the response of this call.
You should provide a text as first argument, and optionally a locator to narrow the search context.
You will also be asked for the platform and the application package.
You will be asked for a Helper to use, you should select Nightmare and provide url of a website you are testing. Setup process is explained on QuickStart page.
You will be asked for a Helper to use, you should select Puppeteer and provide url of a website you are testing.

You will be asked questions about initial configuration, make sure you select Protractor helper. If you didn't have Protractor library it will be installed. Please agree to extend steps, and use http://todomvc.com/examples/angularjs/ as a url for Protractor helper.
and so we can add even more tests!
and use them in your tests:
asserts that an element appears a given number of times in the DOM Element is located by label or name or CSS or XPath.
asserts that an element appears a given number of times in the DOM Element is located by label or name or CSS or XPath. Appium: support
asserts that an element is visible a given number of times Element is located by CSS or XPath.
create and delete data for a test
create unique non-intersecting data sets per each test
defaultHeaders: a list of default headers
describe features in a scenario with a formal text
doesn't work if the Chromium DevTools panel is open (as Chromium allows only one attachment to the debugger at a time. See more)
followRedirect: set to true to enable automatic redirect. Disabled by default
implement each step of a scenario for testing
in any place of your helper. You can also redefine config options inside a constructor:
just press button if no selector is given
or just start session without switching to it. Call session passing only its name:
or use Docker for headless browser testing.
or use global element and by variables to locate elements:
other options are the same as in Protractor config.

outside-in, pull-based, multiple-stakeholder, multiple-scale, high-automation, agile methodology. It describes a cycle of interactions with well-defined outputs, resulting in the delivery of working, tested software that matters.
placeholder for ~ locator only test case write once run on both Appium and WebDriverIO
resetHeaders: set to true to reset headers between requests. Disabled by default
